title: Pascal Jutras-Dub√©
text:
üëã I‚Äôm Pascal Jutras‚ÄëDub√©, a PhD student in Computer Science at Purdue University (advised by Ruqi Zhang). I study sampling and generative modeling through learned stochastic processes, like diffusions and jump processes, and their applications. I‚Äôm currently interested in the theoretical foundations, parallel decoding, test-time alignment, and multimodality of diffusion large language models (dLLMs).
Outside the lab, I co-founded Almost Surely, a fashion brand for the geek community. And when I need a reset, I make fresh pasta: flour, eggs, a little patience: an experiment you can taste.
Now seeking: Summer 2026 research / applied scientist PhD internships (ML, generative modeling, sampling, planning, statistics).

title: Pascal Jutras-Dub√©
text:
Publications


P. Jutras-Dub√©, J. Zhang, Z. Wang, R. Zhang. (2026) One-step diffusion samplers via self-distillation and deterministic flow. Annual conference on artificial intelligence and statisticss (AISTATS).


P. Punyamoorty, P. Jutras-Dub√©, R. Zhang, V. Aggarwal, D. Conover, A. Bera. (2025) Dynamic obstacle avoidance through uncertainty-based adaptive planning with diffusion. International conference on intelligent robots and systems (IROS) [Co-first authors].


P. Jutras-Dub√©, P. Pynadath, R. Zhang. (2025) Single-step consistent diffusion samplers. Frontiers in probabilistic inference workshop at ICLR.


P. Mesana, P. Jutras-Dub√©, J. Crowe, G. Vial, G. Caporossi, S. Gambs. (2025) Measuring privacy/utility tradeoffs of format-preserving strategies for data release. Journal of Business Analytics.


P. Jutras-Dub√©, M. B. Al-Khasawneh, Z. Yang, J. Bas, F. Bastin, C. Cirillo. (2024) Copula-based transferable models for synthetic population generation. Transportation Research Part C.


P. Jutras-Dub√©, R. Zhang, A. Bera. (2024) Adaptive planning with generative models under uncertainty. International conference on intelligent robots and systems (IROS).


P. Mesana, P. Jutras-Dub√©, J. Crowe, G. Vial, G. Caporossi. (2024) Evaluating the risk of re-identification in data release strategies: An attacker-centric approach. Hawaii international conference on system sciences (HICSS).

title: Almost Surely
text:
Almost Surely is a fashion brand that views fashion through the lens of technology. We merge fashion with ideas from generative design, internet culture, and 3D aesthetics to create pieces that feel modern.
Visit almost-surely.com

title: Almost Surely
text:
Concepts


L13_512_64_base19 Jacquard Sweater
I trained a GAN and explored internal neuron activations as a ‚Äúdesign space‚Äù; the final face-like motif came from those activation patterns. The design is embedded in a 4-colour yarn-dyed jacquard fully-fashioned sweater of Extrafine Merino Wool.



Delete Tee
This heavyweight t-shirt features a design of a 90s beige ‚ÄúDelete‚Äù key on a soothing blue fabric. This key, seemingly simple, carries the weight of transformation. A blend of vintage aesthetics and contemporary fashion, the Delete Tee is a reminder that every end births a start.



Certainty Tee
The Certainty Tee is a heavyweight red t-shirt featuring a gradual list of levels of certainty, progressing from ‚ÄúYes‚Äù to ‚ÄúDefinitely Not.‚Äù From absolute confidence to hesitant ambiguity, and the finality of ‚ÄúImpossibly,‚Äù the Certainty Tee takes you on a journey through the nuances of assurance and doubt. 


Diffusion2023 Tee
This pale heather gray heavyweight t-shirt is the first I‚Äôve made. The design showcases a heart-shaped jewel box adorned with ‚ÄúAS‚Äù breloques.
